shadho.spaces.BaseSpace¶

class shadho.spaces.BaseSpace[source]¶

Base class for other spaces.

Methods

complexity() Determine the complexity of the search space.
generate() Generate a value from this space.
to_spec() Generate the specification for this search space.
__init__()¶

Initialize self. See help(type(self)) for accurate signature.

complexity()[source]¶

Determine the complexity of the search space.

The BaseSpace is defined over the Pythonic Nonespace, which consists of a single value (None). According to the ``scriptures<https://docs.python.org/3/reference/datamodel.html#the-standard-type-hierarchy>“_ None is singular and infinite, representing the identity and lack of identity simultaneously. Our feeble human minds cannot comprehend this duality, and thus we represent None as 1 for the sake of the Algorithm.

generate()[source]¶

Generate a value from this space.

The BaseSpace is defined over the Pythonic Nonespace, which consists of a single value (None). From this value, we catch a glimpse of the perfection and nihilistic delight that is eternity. Praise the None, for from it we are made whole.

to_spec()[source]¶

Generate the specification for this search space.

The BaseSpace is defined over the Pythonic Nonespace, which consists of a single value (None). How does one specify the void? It may only be represented as the infinite yet incomprehensible None, as decreed by BDFL.
